Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2014 02:13PM mom2two79 wrote: Slappy-Squirrel,  I am really interested in what you find out. I found this site while searching for information on the whole dimpling topic. Is there any way this problem is ever something benign?  I see a bit of dimpling below the nipple area on BOTH breasts, only when my arms are raised. I immediately visited my doc, who did a manual breast exam. He said they felt awesome, zero lumps or signs of a problem. In fact, he said I do not even have any cysts or fibrocystic changes like is so common at my age. I showed him the dimpling and he said it just looks like the way my breasts are 'made' and he really doesn't see it as anything to worry about.  I have been breastfeeding my 2nd child for 2.5 yrs now and he also said that breasts change after pregnancy and breastfeeding and this may just be my 'new normal. He did not really want to send me for further testing at this time.  I'm concerned & not sure what I should do. It looks like a lot of you who hsd dimpling ended up having cancer.  Is it a good sign that it is like that on both sides? Maybe it is a result of structural changes after a long period of breastfeeding?  I would really appreciate any comments. I'm making myself sick with worry.  Oh-a side note. I am on the pill. Around the time I noticed the dimpling a few weeks ago, I had missed 4 days of pills in a row, which caused me to have an early period because it messed up my hormones. My son was in the hospital, stressful time, which is why I missed the pills. Anyway, my hormones are still leveling out. Maybe this is a hormone issue too? I have a definite change of shape on the right side around the nipple, but its not a lump. More like just a puffy look to the areola on that side.  Sorry for the long post.
Posts.Title: Found breast tethering while fixing my hair. :o( Spoomsister Roxybabes

Posts.Content: mom2two79 wrote: Hello everyone. I have only posted here once previously and am now coming up on my dr's appt and getting nervous again. My original appointment had to be postponed because my doc was on maternity leave. Therefore I am no further along with answers as to what if anything is wrong. I was kind of hoping there was a way to post a pic here? I know that none of you can diagnose me. I totally understand and that isn't what I am looking for. However I think I have an indented area in the breast I am concerned with and I was hoping someone could tell me if it looks similar to what they experienced?  My symptoms have been breast swelling, shape changes, & pain. No redness or swelling. I am most concerned over the possible indented area though. Thanks to all. You're an amazing bunch.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: appt next week & feeling anxious mom2two79 mom2two79
